title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement kotov.egor@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to rdocdump
text: outlines propose change rdocdump. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to rdocdump
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to rdocdump
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to rdocdump
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("e-kotov/rdocdump", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to rdocdump
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to rdocdump
text: Please note rdocdump project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Quick Start: dump R docs and vignettes to text files for LLMs
text: rdocdump R package designed combine R package’s documentation vignettes single plain text file. particularly useful want ingest complete package documentation large language models (LLMs) archival purposes. rdocdump works installed packages, source directories, tar.gz archives, package sources available CRAN.

title: Quick Start: dump R docs and vignettes to text files for LLMs
text: install development version rdocdump GitHub, run following commands:
code: # install.packages("pak") # Uncomment if pak is not installed pak::pak("e-kotov/rdocdump")

title: Quick Start: dump R docs and vignettes to text files for LLMs
text: default, rdocdump stores temporary files directory within R’s temporary directory. can override setting custom cache path using helper function rdd_set_cache_path(). example: ensures temporary tar.gz archives extracted files stored specified directory.
code: # Set a custom cache directory cache_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), "my_rdocdump_cache") rdd_set_cache_path(cache_dir) rdocdump.cache_path set to: /private/var/folders/gb/t5zr5rn15sldqybrmqbyh6y80000gn/T/Rtmpp5wRxV/my_rdocdump_cache

title: Quick Start: dump R docs and vignettes to text files for LLMs
text: main function rdocdump rdd_to_txt(), accepts several types inputs pkg argument: installed package name (e.g., "stats"). full path package source directory. full path package archive (tar.gz). package name available CRAN (downloaded automatically installed). example downloads source package rJavaEnv CRAN, extracts documentation, saves file: prefer simply get combined documentation character string, call function without file argument:
code: # Extract documentation for 'rJavaEnv' and save to a text file. rdd_to_txt(   pkg = "rJavaEnv",   file = "rJavaEnv_docs.txt",   force_fetch = TRUE,    # Force download even if the package is installed.   keep_files = "none"      # Delete temporary files after extraction. ) Fetching package source from CRAN... trying URL 'https://cran.rstudio.com/src/contrib/rJavaEnv_0.2.2.tar.gz' Content type 'application/x-gzip' length 138667 bytes (135 KB) ================================================== downloaded 135 KB  [1] "rJavaEnv_docs.txt" # Extract and capture the combined documentation in a variable. docs <- rdd_to_txt(pkg = "stats") cat(substr(docs, 1, 1000))  # Print the first 1000 characters for a preview. DESCRIPTION: Package: stats Version: 4.4.3 Priority: base Title: The R Stats Package Author: R Core Team and contributors worldwide Maintainer: R Core Team <do-use-Contact-address@r-project.org> Contact: R-help mailing list <r-help@r-project.org> Description: R statistical functions. License: Part of R 4.4.3 Imports: utils, grDevices, graphics Suggests: MASS, Matrix, SuppDists, methods, stats4 NeedsCompilation: yes Encoding: UTF-8 Enhances: Kendall, coin, multcomp, pcaPP, pspearman, robustbase Built: R 4.4.3; aarch64-apple-darwin20; 2025-02-28 21:20:18 UTC; unix  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Function: AIC() Akaike's An Information Criterion  Description:       Generic function calculating Akaike's ‘An Information Criterion’      for one or several fitted model objects for which a log-likelihood      value can be obtained, according to the formula -2*log-likelihood      + k*npar, where npar represents the number of parameters in the

what: Choosing what to dump to text
title: Quick Start: dump R docs and vignettes to text files for LLMs
text: can also choose want just package documentaiton, just vignettes, combined content argument: can see , vignettes combined:
code: docs <- rdd_to_txt(   pkg = "utils",   content = "vignettes" ) cat(substr(docs, 1, 1000))  # Print the first 1000 characters for a preview. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Vignette: Sweave.Rnw  % File src/library/utils/vignettes/Sweave.Rnw % Part of the R package, https://www.R-project.org % Copyright 2002-2022 Friedrich Leisch and the R Core Team % Distributed under GPL 2 or later  \documentclass[a4paper]{article}  %\VignetteIndexEntry{Sweave User Manual} %\VignettePackage{utils} %\VignetteDepends{tools, datasets, stats, graphics}  \title{Sweave User Manual} \author{Friedrich Leisch and R Core Team}  \usepackage[round]{natbib} \usepackage{graphicx, Rd} \usepackage{listings}  \lstset{frame=trbl,basicstyle=\small\tt} \usepackage{hyperref} \usepackage{color} \definecolor{Blue}{rgb}{0,0,0.8} \hypersetup{% colorlinks,% plainpages=true,% linkcolor=black,% citecolor=black,% urlcolor=Blue,% %pdfstartview=FitH,% or Fit pdfstartview={XYZ null null 1},% pdfview={XYZ null null null},% pdfpagemode=UseNone,% for no outline pdfauthor={Friedrich Leisch and R Core Team},% pdftitle={Sweave

title: Quick Start: dump R docs and vignettes to text files for LLMs
text: argument keep_files controls whether temporary files (downloaded archive /extracted directory) retained: "none" (default): Delete tar.gz archive extracted files. "tgz": Keep tar.gz archive. "extracted": Keep extracted files. "": Keep tar.gz archive extracted files. Choose option best fits workflow.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Egor Kotov. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kotov E (2025). rdocdump: Dump R Package Documentation Vignettes One File. doi:10.32614/CRAN.package.rdocdump, https://github.com/e-kotov/rdocdump.
code: @Manual{rdocdump,   title = {rdocdump: Dump R Package Documentation and Vignettes into One File},   author = {Egor Kotov},   year = {2025},   url = {https://github.com/e-kotov/rdocdump},   doi = {10.32614/CRAN.package.rdocdump}, }

what: rdocdump: Dump R Package Documentation and Vignettes into One File
title: rdocdump: Dump R Package Documentation and Vignettes into One File
text: Dump R documentation vignettes R packages single file. Supports installed packages, tar.gz archives, package source directories. package installed, source automatically downloaded CRAN processing. output single plain text file ‘character’, useful ingest complete package documentation large language model (‘LLM’).

title: rdocdump: Dump R Package Documentation and Vignettes into One File
text: can install development version rdocdump GitHub :

title: rdocdump: Dump R Package Documentation and Vignettes into One File
text: Extract documenation rJavaEnv package downloading source CRAN save file rJavaEnv_docs.txt
code: rdd_to_txt(   pkg = "rJavaEnv",   file = "rJavaEnv_docs.txt",   force_fetch = TRUE, # force download even if package is installed   keep_files = "none" # delete temp files )

title: rdocdump: Dump R Package Documentation and Vignettes into One File
text: cite package ‘rdocdump’ publications use: Kotov E (2025). rdocdump: Dump R Package Documentation Vignettes One File. doi:10.32614/CRAN.package.rdocdump https://doi.org/10.32614/CRAN.package.rdocdump, https://github.com/e-kotov/rdocdump. BibTeX:
code: @Manual{rdocdump,   title = {rdocdump: Dump R Package Documentation and Vignettes into One File},   author = {Egor Kotov},   year = {2025},   url = {https://github.com/e-kotov/rdocdump},   doi = {10.32614/CRAN.package.rdocdump}, }

what: Extract R Source Code from a Package — rdd_extract_code
title: Extract R Source Code from a Package — rdd_extract_code
text: function extracts R source code package. installed packages, retrieves package namespace deparses functions found package. package source directories archives (non-installed packages), reads .R files R directory , optionally, tests directory. Optionally, can include roxygen2 documentation files.

title: Extract R Source Code from a Package — rdd_extract_code
code: rdd_extract_code(   pkg,   file = NULL,   include_tests = FALSE,   include_roxygen = FALSE,   force_fetch = FALSE,   cache_path = getOption("rdocdump.cache_path"),   repos = getOption("rdocdump.repos", getOption("repos")) )

title: Extract R Source Code from a Package — rdd_extract_code
text: pkg character string specifying package. can : installed package name, full path package source directory, full path package archive file (tar.gz), package name installed (downloaded CRAN). file Optional. Save path output text file. set, function return path file instead combined text. Defaults NULL. include_tests logical. TRUE, non-installed packages, function also include R source code tests directory. Defaults FALSE. include_roxygen logical. TRUE, roxygen2 documentation lines (lines starting "#'") R files included output. Defaults FALSE. force_fetch logical. TRUE, package source fetched CRAN even package installed locally. Default FALSE. cache_path character string specifying directory use cache. Defaults value getOption("rdocdump.cache_path"). repos character vector repository URLs. default, uses value getOption("rdocdump.repos") sets repository URLs default R repositories set c("CRAN" = "https://cloud.r-project.org") package load prevent accidental downloads pre-built packages Posit Package Manager R Universe.

title: Extract R Source Code from a Package — rdd_extract_code
text: single string containing combined R source code (, optionally, roxygen2 documentation) package.

title: Extract R Source Code from a Package — rdd_extract_code
code:
# Extract only R source code (excluding roxygen2 documentation) from an installed package. code <- rdd_extract_code("stats") cat(substr(code, 1, 1000)) #> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- #> Function: .Diag() #> function (nms, sparse)  #> { #>     n <- as.integer(length(nms)) #>     d <- c(n, n) #>     dn <- list(nms, nms) #>     if (sparse) { #>         if (!suppressPackageStartupMessages(requireNamespace("Matrix")))  #>             stop(gettextf("%s needs package 'Matrix' correctly installed",  #>                 "contr*(.., sparse=TRUE)"), domain = NA) #>         methods::new("ddiMatrix", diag = "U", Dim = d, Dimnames = dn) #>     } #>     else array(c(rep.int(c(1, numeric(n)), n - 1L), 1), d, dn) #> } #>  #> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- #> Function: .MFclass() #> function (x)  #> { #>     if (is.logical(x))  #>         return("logical") #>     if (is.ordered(x))  #>         return("ordered") #>     if (is.factor(x))  #>         return("factor") #>     if (is.character(x))  #>         return("character") #>     if (is.matrix(x) && is.numeric(x))  #>         return(paste0("nmatrix.", ncol(x))) #>     if (is.numeric(x))  #>        # Extract R source code including roxygen2 documentation from a package source directory. local({  code_with_roxygen <- rdd_extract_code(   "ini",   include_roxygen = TRUE,   force_fetch = TRUE,   repos = c("CRAN" = "https://cran.r-project.org") )  cat(substr(code_with_roxygen, 1, 1000)) }) #> Fetching package source from CRAN... #>  #> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- #> File: ini.R #>  #> #' Read and parse .ini file to list #> #' #> #' @param filepath file to parse #> #' @param encoding Encoding of filepath parameter, will default to system #> #' encoding if not specifield #> #' #> #' @details Lines starting with '#' or ';' are comments and will not be parsed #> #' #> #' @seealso \code{\link{write.ini}} #> #' #> #' @return List with length equivalent to number of [sections], each section is #> #' a new list #> #' #> #' @examples #> #' ## Create a new temp ini for reading #> #' iniFile <- tempfile(fileext = '.ini') #> #' #> #' sink(iniFile) #> #' cat("; This line is a comment
") #> #' cat("# This one too!
") #> #' cat("[    Hello World]
") #> #' cat("Foo = Bar          
") #> #' cat("Foo1 = Bar=345 
") #> #' sink() #> #' #> #' ## Read ini #> #' checkini <- read.ini(iniFile) #> #' #> #' ## Check structure #> #' checkini #> #' checkini$`Hello World`$Foo #> #' #> #' @export #> #' #> read.ini <- function(filepath, encoding = getOption("encoding")) { #>  #>   index <- function(x, run  # Extract R source code from a package source directory, # including test files but excluding roxygen2 docs. local({  code_with_tests <- rdd_extract_code(   "ini",   include_roxygen = TRUE,   include_tests = TRUE,   force_fetch = TRUE,   repos = c("CRAN" = "https://cran.r-project.org") )  cat(substr(code_with_tests, 1, 1000)) }) #> Fetching package source from CRAN... #>  #> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- #> File: ini.R #>  #> #' Read and parse .ini file to list #> #' #> #' @param filepath file to parse #> #' @param encoding Encoding of filepath parameter, will default to system #> #' encoding if not specifield #> #' #> #' @details Lines starting with '#' or ';' are comments and will not be parsed #> #' #> #' @seealso \code{\link{write.ini}} #> #' #> #' @return List with length equivalent to number of [sections], each section is #> #' a new list #> #' #> #' @examples #> #' ## Create a new temp ini for reading #> #' iniFile <- tempfile(fileext = '.ini') #> #' #> #' sink(iniFile) #> #' cat("; This line is a comment
") #> #' cat("# This one too!
") #> #' cat("[    Hello World]
") #> #' cat("Foo = Bar          
") #> #' cat("Foo1 = Bar=345 
") #> #' sink() #> #' #> #' ## Read ini #> #' checkini <- read.ini(iniFile) #> #' #> #' ## Check structure #> #' checkini #> #' checkini$`Hello World`$Foo #> #' #> #' @export #> #' #> read.ini <- function(filepath, encoding = getOption("encoding")) { #>  #>   index <- function(x, run

what: Get Current rdocdump Repository Options — rdd_get_repos
title: Get Current rdocdump Repository Options — rdd_get_repos
text: function returns current repository URLs used rdocdump.

title: Get Current rdocdump Repository Options — rdd_get_repos
Get Current rdocdump Repository Options — rdd_get_repos
text: character vector repository URLs.

title: Get Current rdocdump Repository Options — rdd_get_repos
code: # Get current rdocdump repository options rdd_get_repos() #>                          CRAN  #> "https://cloud.r-project.org"

what: Set rdocdump Cache Path in the Current R Session — rdd_set_cache_path
title: Set rdocdump Cache Path in the Current R Session — rdd_set_cache_path
text: function sets cache path used rdocdump store temporary files (downloaded tar.gz archives /extracted directories) current R session. cache path stored option "rdocdump.cache_path", can checked getOption("rdocdump.cache_path"). path created exist.

title: Set rdocdump Cache Path in the Current R Session — rdd_set_cache_path
Set rdocdump Cache Path in the Current R Session — rdd_set_cache_path
text: path character string specifying directory used cache path.

title: Set rdocdump Cache Path in the Current R Session — rdd_set_cache_path
text: Invisibly returns new cache path.

title: Set rdocdump Cache Path in the Current R Session — rdd_set_cache_path
code: # set cache directory for `rdocdump` rdd_set_cache_path(paste0(tempdir(), "/rdocdump_cache")) #> rdocdump.cache_path set to: /tmp/RtmpuNVVKH/rdocdump_cache

title: Set rdocdump Repository Options — rdd_set_repos
text: function sets repository URLs used rdocdump fetching package sources.

title: Set rdocdump Repository Options — rdd_set_repos
Set rdocdump Repository Options — rdd_set_repos
text: repos character vector repository URLs.

title: Set rdocdump Repository Options — rdd_set_repos
text: Invisibly returns new repository URLs.

title: Set rdocdump Repository Options — rdd_set_repos
code: # Set rdocdump repository options rdd_set_repos(c("CRAN" = "https://cloud.r-project.org")) #> rdocdump.repos set to: https://cloud.r-project.org

what: Create Combined Package Documentation as Text — rdd_to_txt
title: Create Combined Package Documentation as Text — rdd_to_txt
text: function produces single text output package processing documentation (Rd files package source documentation already installed packages), vignettes, /R source code.

title: Create Combined Package Documentation as Text — rdd_to_txt
code: rdd_to_txt(   pkg,   file = NULL,   content = "all",   force_fetch = FALSE,   keep_files = "none",   cache_path = getOption("rdocdump.cache_path"),   repos = getOption("rdocdump.repos", getOption("repos")) )

title: Create Combined Package Documentation as Text — rdd_to_txt
text: pkg character string specifying package. can : installed package name, full path package source directory, full path package archive file (tar.gz), package name installed (downloaded CRAN). file Optional. Save path output text file. set, function return path file instead combined text. Defaults NULL. content character vector specifying components include output. Possible values : "": Include Rd documentation, vignettes, R source code (default). "docs": Include Rd documentation. "vignettes": Include vignettes. "code": Include R source code. extracting code non-installed packages, function include roxygen2 documentation, documentation can imported Rd files. want extract R source code roxygen2 documentation, use rdd_extract_code set include_roxygen TRUE. can specify multiple options (e.g., c("docs", "code") include documentation source code). force_fetch logical. TRUE, package source fetched CRAN tar.gz archive even package already installed locally. Default FALSE. keep_files character value controlling whether temporary files kept. Possible values : "none": Delete tar.gz archive extracted files (default). "tgz": Keep tar.gz archive. "extracted": Keep extracted files. "": Keep tar.gz archive extracted files. cache_path character string specifying directory kept temporary files stored. default, uses value getOption("rdocdump.cache_path") sets cache directory temporary directory current R session. repos character vector repository URLs. default, uses value getOption("rdocdump.repos") sets repository URLs default R repositories set c("CRAN" = "https://cloud.r-project.org") package load prevent accidental downloads pre-built packages Posit Package Manager R Universe.

title: Create Combined Package Documentation as Text — rdd_to_txt
text: single string containing combined package documentation, vignettes, /code specified content argument. file argument set, returns path file.

title: Create Combined Package Documentation as Text — rdd_to_txt
code:
# Extract documentation for built-in `stats` package (both docs and vignettes). docs <- rdd_to_txt("stats") cat(substr(docs, 1, 500)) #> DESCRIPTION: #> Package: stats #> Version: 4.4.3 #> Priority: base #> Title: The R Stats Package #> Author: R Core Team and contributors worldwide #> Maintainer: R Core Team <do-use-Contact-address@r-project.org> #> Contact: R-help mailing list <r-help@r-project.org> #> Description: R statistical functions. #> License: Part of R 4.4.3 #> Imports: utils, grDevices, graphics #> Suggests: MASS, Matrix, SuppDists, methods, stats4 #> NeedsCompilation: yes #> Encoding: UTF-8 #> Enhances: Kendall, coin, multcomp, pcaPP, pspearman, robustbase #> B  # \donttest{ # Extract only documentation for rJavaEnv by downloading its source from CRAN docs <- rdd_to_txt(   "rJavaEnv",   force_fetch = TRUE,   content = "docs",   repos = c("CRAN" = "https://cran.r-project.org") ) #> Fetching package source from CRAN... lines <- unlist(strsplit(docs, "
")) # Print the first 3 lines cat(head(lines, 3), sep = "
") #> DESCRIPTION: #> Package: rJavaEnv #> Title: 'Java' Environments for R Projects # Print the last 3 lines cat(tail(lines, 3), sep = "
") #>      "17" == java_check_version_rjava(quiet = TRUE) #>      ## End(Not run) #>       # }
